subject: Art
title: Mixing Colors
description: The practical skill of creating any color from a limited palette.

hook.text: You need a specific dusty sage green. You don't have it in a tube. But with understanding of color mixing, you can create it from the colors you DO have.

buildup.text: Start with the base hue (blue + yellow = green). Adjust value (add white to lighten or a dark to darken). Adjust saturation (add the complement or gray to mute it). Adjust temperature (lean warmer or cooler).

discovery.text: Every mixed color is a three-step recipe: (1) Get the right hue family. (2) Get the right value. (3) Get the right saturation. Approach mixing in this order and you'll nail any color.

twist.text: Physical paint mixing is subtractive â€” mixing more colors makes things darker and muddier. Less mixing is better. Two colors mixed are vivid. Four colors mixed are mud.

climax.text: Exercise: pick a color you see in your room. Try to mix it from just red, yellow, blue, and white. It forces you to truly understand what makes that color tick.

punchline.text: You don't need 50 tubes of paint. You need understanding of how to mix 4.

quiz.question: What is the correct order for mixing a target color?
options: Hue first, then value, then saturation
